page.title: 08CARING FOR ELDERLY HERNE BAY
page.content: I have heard Herne Bay referred to as the old age capital of England, because of the number of old people in the area and the number of old people's homes. As the holiday trade has declined many people have been forced to find a new means of income and Herne Bay which is something of a quiet backwater also has the large old Victorian and Edwardian houses which can be adapted for this purpose. It is difficult to estimate just how many old people's homes there are in the town as some private families look after old people in an extension of their homes and this would not be apparent from the exterior of the house. Out of our class of 28 children at Hampton School, five of the mothers worked looking after old people in some professional capacity.
